attributes.action: Discuss with hindsight and re-evaluate the reaction and measures for Covid 19
attributes.additional_details: It’s important to work on information made available, pre-pandemic we were advised that Covid19 was not transmissible. The more we learn about how infectious the virus is and asymptomatic people are, is it not probable we have reached an earlier peak without any overwhelming of services or need for social distancing measures, considering the virus was circulating in Europe in December and no measures were in place and no travel measures still are in place. Can we re-evaluate our position now?
attributes.background: Discuss with hindsight, based on new information about France’s patient zero in December and China’s in November, the possibility Covid19 has circulated around undetected for months without any overwhelming of services despite the nature of the virus and no social distancing or lockdown measures.
